section.name: Estimating parameters
section.topText: A normal linear model can be used for many bivariate data sets, but its three parameters are unknown values in most practical situations.
section.page: A least squares line provides estimates of the linear model's slope and intercept. These estimates are random values -- they vary from sample to sample.
The third parameter of the normal linear model is the error standard deviation. It can be estimated using the residuals from the least squares line.
